meanings.definition: To prevent or ward off something
meanings.sent1: I will forefend the rain by carrying an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: She used bug spray to forefend mosquito bites during the hike.
meanings.sent3: The brave knight tried to forefend the dragon's fiery breath with a tiny shield.
meanings.sent4: The scarecrow stood in the field, arms outstretched to forefend the hungry crows.
meanings.sent5: The security guard's job is to forefend any unauthorized entry into the building.

meanings.definition: To protect or defend against something
meanings.sent1: The mother bear will forefend her cubs from any danger in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Wearing sunscreen can help forefend against harmful UV rays.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was said to forefend him from all harm.
meanings.sent4: The ancient walls were built to forefend the city from enemy attacks.
meanings.sent5: The antivirus software works to forefend your computer from malicious threats.
